solution.text:
Here the maximum class frequency is _{j}_,
And,
The class corresponding to this frequency is 25 - 40.
So, the modal class is 25 - 40.
Now
Modal class = 25 - 40, lower limit (l ) of modal class = 25,
class size (h) = 15
frequency ( f1 ) of the modal class = _{j}_,
frequency ( f0 ) of class preceding the modal class = _{i}_,
frequency ( f2 ) of class succeeding the modal class = _{k}_.
Now, let us substitute these values in the formula :
Mode = l + (\((f1-f0)\over (2*f1-f0-f2)\))*h
Mode = 25 + (\((_{j}_-_{i}_)\over (2*_{j}_-_{i}_-_{k}_)\))*15
Mode = 25 + \(_{{j-i}}_\over _{{(2*j)-i-k}}_\)*15
Mode = 25 + (_{{trunc((Decimal(j)-i)/((2*j)-i-k),3)}}_)*15
Mode = 25 + (_{{trunc(((Decimal(j)-i)/((2*j)-i-k))*15,3)}}_)
Mode = _{{trunc((25+((Decimal(j)-i)/((2*j)-i-k))*15),3)}}_

content.text:
A study was done to find out the Percentage of NaCl in water of different rivers of India.Following table contains the data collected during the study.Find the modal percentage of NaCl.
\begin{array}{c|lcr} Percentage of NaCl & \text{10-25} & \text{25-40} & \text{40-55} & \text{55-70} & \text{70-85} \\ \hline \ No. of rivers & _{i}_ & _{j}_ & _{k}_ & _{l}_ & _{m}_ \\ \hline\end{array}
